Description: Floor and flaring foot sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, probably a cup with everted rim; rather heavy build and much worn; wholly glazed save for underside, where there is a glaze band on lower part of inside of foot; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the ring foot possibly finds parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers at in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 176)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 656, no. 137)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.656) (Phase 3)
